drupalNodeEvent.title: Understanding Policy Preferences of the Chinese Public: Configuration, Stability, and Intensity

field_speakers.processed: Yiqing Xu, Assistant Professor, Department of Political Science, Stanford University

field_organizers.processed: 21st Century China Center, UC San Diego School of Global Policy & Strategy

field_description.processed: Understanding the nature of societal preferences has important implications for the emergence of party systems, the dynamics of political conflict, and the direction of political development. However, policy preferences of the Chinese public have received relatively little scholarly attention. Using a series of surveys and experiments administrated online, we study the configuration, stability, and intensity of policy preferences in China.
